articles.headline: Valeant Chief, at Senate Hearing, Concedes Mistakes on Steep Drug Prices
articles.snippet: “It was a mistake to pursue, and in hindsight I regret pursuing, transactions where a central premise was a planned increase in the prices of the medicines,” J. Michael Pearson testified.
articles.abstract: “It was a mistake to pursue, and in hindsight I regret pursuing, transactions where a central premise was a planned increase in the prices of the medicines,” J. Michael Pearson testified.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The chief executive of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International, which has been harshly criticized for its practice of raising prices on old drugs, said during a tense hearing on Capitol Hill on Wednesday that the company had made “mistakes,” while lawmakers accused him and others connected to Valeant of favoring profits over patients’ needs.

articles.headline: Donald Trump, Laying Out Foreign Policy, Promises Coherence
articles.snippet: “We’re going to finally have a coherent foreign policy, based on American interests and the shared interests of our allies,” Mr. Trump pledged.
articles.abstract: “We’re going to finally have a coherent foreign policy, based on American interests and the shared interests of our allies,” Mr. Trump pledged.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Donald J. Trump, exuding confidence after his resounding primary victories in the East, promised a foreign policy on Wednesday that he said would put “America first.” He castigated President Obama and Hillary Clinton, a former secretary of state and a possible opponent in the general election, for what he described as a string of missteps that have disillusioned the nation’s allies and emboldened its rivals.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Ashley Parker

articles.headline: Facebook Plans New Stock Class to Solidify Mark Zuckerberg’s Control
articles.snippet: The announcement came as Facebook announced a tripling in its quarterly profit to $1.5 billion, with sales up 52 percent.
articles.abstract: The announcement came as Facebook announced a tripling in its quarterly profit to $1.5 billion, with sales up 52 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Mark Zuckerberg nurtured Facebook from a dorm room idea into the world’s biggest social network. Now the company is taking steps to ensure its founder remains in charge.
articles.byline: By Mike Isaac and Leslie Picker

articles.headline: Target Steps Out in Front of Bathroom Choice Debate
articles.snippet: The retailer said transgender employees and customers could choose which restroom they preferred to use, a position that centered it in a national debate.
articles.abstract: The retailer said transgender employees and customers could choose which restroom they preferred to use, a position that centered it in a national debate.
articles.lead_paragraph: A new policy over bathroom choice has thrust the retailer Target into the center of a nationwide debate over gender identity, civil rights and privacy.

articles.headline: After Losses, Ted Cruz Picks Carly Fiorina as Running Mate and Bernie Sanders Retrenches
articles.snippet: Senator Bernie Sanders and Senator Ted Cruz abruptly reordered their campaigns, aiming to preserve some hope of primary victories.
articles.abstract: Senator Bernie Sanders and Senator Ted Cruz abruptly reordered their campaigns, aiming to preserve some hope of primary victories.
articles.lead_paragraph: Reeling from their losses in Tuesday’s Democratic and Republican primaries, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont and Senator Ted Cruz of Texas abruptly reordered their campaigns on Wednesday, aiming to preserve some small hope that the race might yet turn in their favor.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Yamiche Alcindor

articles.headline: VW Chief ‘Personally’ Apologized to Obama Over Cheating
articles.snippet: The automaker said it had set aside about $7.9 billion for legal costs worldwide over its test rigging, less than it faces in the United States alone.
articles.abstract: The automaker said it had set aside about $7.9 billion for legal costs worldwide over its test rigging, less than it faces in the United States alone.
articles.lead_paragraph: WOLFSBURG, Germany — The chief executive of Volkswagen said on Thursday that he personally apologized to President Obama this week for cheating on vehicle emissions tests, speaking up for its work force as the German carmaker negotiates penalties with United States officials.

articles.headline: Clampdown in China Restricts 7,000 Foreign Organizations
articles.snippet: The new law is aimed at limiting the work of foreign nongovernmental organizations and their local partners, mainly through police supervision.
articles.abstract: The new law is aimed at limiting the work of foreign nongovernmental organizations and their local partners, mainly through police supervision.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China took a major step on Thursday in President Xi Jinping’s drive to impose greater control and limit Western influences on Chinese society, as it passed a new law restricting the work of foreign organizations and their local partners, mainly through police supervision.

articles.headline: Chris Wallace, In-House Moderate at Fox News, Has Less Predictable Targets
articles.snippet: At a tricky moment for Fox, Mr. Wallace has been allowed leeway, even including criticizing his own network.
articles.abstract: At a tricky moment for Fox, Mr. Wallace has been allowed leeway, even including criticizing his own network.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It seemed like a chummy reunion between friends. Chris Wallace, the Fox News anchor, was chatting amiably in his studio here on Sunday with Paul J. Manafort, Donald J. Trump’s new campaign chief, reminiscing about Ronald Reagan as the seconds ticked down to airtime.

articles.headline: The Recovery’s Two Sides: Weak Growth Even as Hiring Surges
articles.snippet: The trajectory of the economic recovery remains frustratingly uneven nearly seven years after it began — but plenty is going right at the same time.
articles.abstract: The trajectory of the economic recovery remains frustratingly uneven nearly seven years after it began — but plenty is going right at the same time.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s gross domestic product advanced at a mere 0.5 percent annual growth rate during the first quarter after a mediocre increase for the final quarter of 2015, the Commerce Department reported on Thursday, suggesting that the economy is stalled.

articles.headline: DreamWorks Animation Sale Leaves Jeffrey Katzenberg at a Crossroads
articles.snippet: Jeffrey Katzenberg energetically ran the boutique studio, but its fortunes often seemed star-crossed.
articles.abstract: Jeffrey Katzenberg energetically ran the boutique studio, but its fortunes often seemed star-crossed.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — For the past decade, Jeffrey Katzenberg’s identity has been indistinguishable from the DreamWorks Animation brand. A relentless advocate for his little studio, he became famous for making 40 phone calls and conducting three breakfast meetings before 10 a.m. (He always orders the same thing: Diet Coke.)
articles.byline: By Brooks Barnes, Emily Steel and Michael Cieply
